Race.SummaryText:
PARISHWIDE PROPOSITION

SUMMARY:  AMENDING THE PLAN OF GOVERNMENT OF THE CITY OF BATON ROUGE AND PARISH OF EAST BATON ROUGE AS MORE SPECIFICALLY DESCRIBED IN THE SUMMARY OF PROPOSED AMENDMENTS TO THE PLAN OF GOVERNMENT DATED JUNE 13, 2007.
Race.FullText: Shall the Plan of Government of the City of Baton Rouge and Parish of East Baton Rouge (the "Plan") be amended, effective on and after October 20, 2007, as more specifically described in the Summary of Proposed Amendments to the Plan of Government dated June 13, 2007, which Summary of Proposed Changes to the Plan of Government may be reviewed on the official website (brgov.com) of the City of Baton Rouge and Parish of East Baton Rouge or may be obtained from the Council Administrator for the City of Baton Rouge and Parish of East Baton Rouge, and which proposed amendments are hereby incorporated by reference and made a part of this Proposition?

Race.SpecificTitle: Parishwide -- Sale Alcoholic Beverages - Metro Council
Race.SummaryText:
PARISHWIDE PROPOSITION

SUMMARY:  DIRECTING THE METROPOLITAN COUNCIL TO AMEND ORDINANCE 13126 ADOPTED BY THE METROPOLITAN COUNCIL ON NOVEMBER 23, 2004, SO AS TO AMEND SECTION 5 THEREOF TO ALLOW CLASS B LICENSE HOLDERS TO SELL ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES ON SUNDAYS, TO ALLOW CLASS A LICENSE HOLDERS TO SELL ALCOHOL ON CHRISTMAS EVE AND NEW YEARS EVE (IF SUCH DATES FALL ON A SUNDAY) AND SUPER BOWL SUNDAYS, AND TO ALLOW CERTAIN NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS TO SELL ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES ON SUNDAYS.
Race.FullText: Shall the Metropolitan Council of the Parish of East Baton Rouge and City of Baton Rouge, acting as governing authority of the Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), under the provisions of La. R.S. 51:191, and other constitutional and statutory authority, be required to adopt an ordinance amending Ordinance 13126 adopted by the Metropolitan Council on November 23, 2004, so as to amend Section 5 thereof (i) to allow Class B license holders to sell alcoholic beverages between 11:00 a.m. on Sundays to 12:00 a.m. on the following day, (ii) to allow Class A license holders to sell alcohol on Christmas Eve and New Years Eve (if such dates fall on a Sunday), and Super Bowl Sundays, between 11:00 a.m. on such Sunday to 2:00 a.m. on the following day, and (iii)  to allow religious, charitable, fraternal, veterans and other private clubs which are non-profit organizations in nature and classified as such by all taxing authorities to sell alcoholic beverages between 11:00 a.m. on Sundays to 12:00 a.m. on the following day?

Race.SpecificTitle: Fire Prot. Dist. No. 1 -- 9.0 Mills - Metro Council - 3 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
FIRE PROTECTION DISTRICT NO. 1 PROPOSITION

SUMMARY:  9.0 MILLS PROPERTY TAX FOR A PERIOD OF THREE (3) YEARS TO PROVIDE FUNDS FOR DEVELOPING, MAINTAINING AND OPERATING THE FIRE PROTECTION FACILITIES OF THE FIRE PROTECTION DISTRICT NO. 1 OF THE PARISH OF EAST BATON ROUGE, LOUISIANA.
Race.FullText: Shall the Fire Protection District No. 1 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge, Louisiana, under the provisions of Article VI, Section 19 of the 1974 Louisiana Constitution, Section 1501 of Title 40 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, as amended, and other constitutional and statutory authority supplemental thereto, be authorized to levy and collect, and adopt an ordinance providing for such levy and collection, of an ad valorem tax of 9.0 mills (the "Tax"), in each calendar year on all property subject to taxation in the Fire Protection District No. 1 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge, Louisiana (an estimated $153,200 is reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of three (3) years, commencing in the year 2008, to and including the year 2010, and shall the avails or proceeds of said Tax (after paying the reasonable and necessary expenses of collection and administering the Tax, if any) be used entirely and exclusively for the development, operation and maintenance of the fire protection facilities of the Fire Protection District No. 1 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge, Louisiana, and paying the costs of obtaining water for fire protection purposes, including charges for fire hydrant rentals and service, within the Fire Protection District No. 1 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge, Louisiana?

Race.SpecificTitle: Fire Prot. Dist. No. 1 -- $32.00 Service Chrg.-Metro Council - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
FIRE PROTECTION DISTRICT NO. 1 PROPOSITION

SUMMARY:  $32.00 PER ANNUM SERVICE CHARGE FOR A PERIOD OF TEN (10) YEARS TO PROVIDE FUNDS FOR FIRE PROTECTION PURPOSES WITHIN THE FIRE PROTECTION DISTRICT NO. 1 OF THE PARISH OF EAST BATON ROUGE, LOUISIANA.
Race.FullText: Shall the Fire Protection District No. 1 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge, Louisiana, under the provisions of Article VI, Section 19 of the 1974 Louisiana Constitution, Section 1502.1 of Title 40 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, as amended, and other constitutional and statutory authority supplemental thereto, be authorized to levy and collect, and adopt an ordinance providing for such levy and collection, of a service charge of $32.00 per annum (the "Service Charge"), for each residential or commercial structure, whether occupied or unoccupied, located wholly or partly within the boundaries of the Fire Protection District No. 1 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge, Louisiana (an estimated $46,400 is reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the service charge for an entire year), in each calendar year, for a period of ten (10) years, commencing in the year 2008 to and including the year 2017, and shall the avails or proceeds of the Service Charge (after paying the reasonable and necessary expenses of collection and administering the Service Charge, if any) be used entirely and exclusively for fire protection purposes within the Fire Protection District No. 1 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge, Louisiana?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Central -- 2% S&U - City Council
Race.SummaryText:
CITY OF CENTRAL PROPOSITION
(SALES AND USE TAX)

SUMMARY:   2% SALES AND USE TAX FOR GENERAL MUNICIPAL PURPOSES FOR THE CITY OF CENTRAL INCLUDING ACQUIRING, CONSTRUCTING, IMPROVING, AND MAINTAINING PUBLIC WORKS, SUBJECT TO FUNDING INTO BONDS.
Race.FullText: Shall the Council for the City of Central be authorized to levy a tax of two percent (2%) ("Tax") upon the sale at retail, the use, the lease or rental, the consumption, the storage for use or consumption of tangible personal property and on sales of services, all as presently defined in La. R.S. 47:301 through La. R.S. 47:317, inclusive within the geographic boundaries of the City for general municipal purposes including but not limited to acquiring, constructing, improving and maintaining public works with an estimated annual collection of $5.2 million dollars, said tax to be subject to funding into bonds in the manner provided by Sub-Part F, Part III, Chapter 4, Title 39 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes?

Race.SpecificTitle: St. George FPD No. 2 -- 6 Mill - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
ST. GEORGE FIRE PROTECTION DISTRICT NO. 2 PROPOSITION
(TAX RENEWAL)

SUMMARY:  RENEWAL OF SIX (6) MILL PROPERTY TAX FOR A PERIOD OF TEN (10) YEARS TO PROVIDE FOR THE DEVELOPMENT, OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE OF THE ST. GEORGE FIRE PROTECTION DISTRICT NO. 2.
Race.FullText: Shall the St. George Fire Protection District No. 2, Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana, Under the provisions of Article VI, Section 19 of the 1974 Constitution of Louisiana, Part I of Chapter 7 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, as amended (La. R.S. 40:1501), and other constitutional and statutory authority supplemental thereto, be authorized to levy and collect, and adopt a resolution providing for such levy and collection, of an ad valorem tax of six (6.0) mills (the "Tax") in each calendar year on all property subject to taxation in the St. George Fire Protection District No. 2 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge (an estimated $4,700,000 is reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the Tax for the entire first year, and this amount will increase if the value of property subject to taxation increases) for a period of ten (10) years, commencing in the year 2008 to and including the year 2017, and shall the avails or proceeds of said Tax be used entirely and exclusively for development, operation and maintenance of the fire protection facilities, equipment and personnel of the St. George Fire Protection District No. 2 and paying the costs of obtaining water for fire protection purposes, including charges for fire hydrant rentals and service, within St. George Fire Protection District No. 2 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge?
